Legal_Issue: Whether judicial review can proceed after applicant's voluntary departure from Canada
Evidence_Assessment: PRRA officer's assessment that applicants were not at risk
Decision_Outcome: Applicants deemed not at risk by PRRA officer
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to demonstrate risk upon return
Credibility_Factor: Applicants' claims of risk as Hungarian Roma citizens
Legal_Rule: Judicial reviews become moot if applicant leaves Canada
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, as applicable under IRPA
Procedural_Issue: Voluntary departure rendering review application moot
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of harm upon return to Hungary due to Roma ethnicity
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Application dismissed due to lack of justiciable matter
Key_Evidence_Considered: PRRA decision, applicants' departure from Canada
Legal_Framework: IRPA, Federal Court rules on mootness
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged PRRA decision claiming risk in Hungary
Defendant_Response: Not explicitly stated, but procedural dismissal applied
Legal_Provision: Sections of IRPA relating to PRRA and judicial review
Claimant_Status: Hungarian Roma citizens, former protected persons
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on PRRA and jurisdiction of Federal Court
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Persecution risk based on nationality and membership in particular social group
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Judicial review application pending at time of departure
Governing_Rule: Precedents holding that departure from Canada renders judicial review moot
